metaData.descriptionCS: The child answers questions based on his or her understanding of general principles and social situations.

answers.text: It’s good
If you eat candy or drink pop
Brush teeth to go to the dentist
People will think you’re gross if you don’t
You are supposed to; Parents make you
So you don’t have to go to the dentist; So dentist bill isn’t high
It’s good for (them, teeth, gums, your mouth)
So teeth don’t get (damaged, hurt)
So teeth don’t have bugs on them
So your teeth don’t fall out; So you don’t lose your teeth

1.answersExplanation: Recognition that brushing one’s teeth cleans the teeth; prevents decay, disease, cavities, and other dental problems; or improves one’s appearance

answers.text: To keep their hygiene; It’s hygienic
Kills germs; Gets germs off of teeth
Keep them clean; So they won’t get dirty
To prevent getting (cavities, gum disease)
So your (teeth, gums) can be healthy
So teeth will not (decay, rot)
So (plaque, tarter) won’t build up
So you don’t get (sores, diseases)
To protect your teeth
So teeth will be (stronger, in better condition)
So they (stay white, won’t turn yellow)
To keep breath smelling good

2.answersExplanation: Recognition that brushing one’s teeth cleans the teeth; prevents decay, disease, cavities, and other dental problems; or improves one’s appearance

(Stay, Run) away

Panic

answers.text: Call for help; Get help
Call (ambulance, hospital)
Tell my (mom, dad); Get my parents to (help, check it out) [Notify adult]

Go see if they are OK; Check on the neighbors [Verify safety of neighbors]
Get them out of the house; See if everyone is out [Evacuate neighbors]
Go see what's wrong; Check and see if there really is a fire; Make sure it isn't a barbecue
Go help; Help them
Get everyone out of your house because it could catch fire [Evacuate your own house]

answers.text: Don’t keep it
Pick it up
Give it to my (mom, dad)
Ask store personnel if it is theirs
Leave it there; Put it back [Take no action]

Try to find the owner
Give it back; Return it

Take it to their house; Call them

1.answersExplanation: Try to return it to the owner, either by looking for identification of the owner and returning it or by giving it to store personnel or a policeman

Take it to the police

Turn it in; Turn in to the (counter, Lost and Found, cashier, security guard)

answers.text: Nothing; Don’t do anything
Stop them
I’d just let him fight
Say you’re sorry; Apologize; Give them what they want

(Punch, Fight, Punish) them; Hit them

answers.text: So they feel better; So the person will be healed; So they won’t (feel bad, stay hurt)

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after 4 consecutive scores of 0.
